verses.text: 建造聖殿以色列人出埃及地以後四百八十年，所羅門作以色列王的第四年西弗月，就是二月，他動工建造耶和華的殿。

words.note: Specifically refers to the Jerusalem Temple in religious texts.
Abbreviation for 'Second Book of Chronicles'.
Biblical month name, equivalent to Iyar (April-May).

verses.text: 所羅門為耶和華所建的殿，長二十七公尺，寬九公尺，高十三公尺半。

words.note: 所 + V indicates a passive construction or refers to 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 殿的前廊長九公尺，和殿的寬度一樣，寬四公尺半。
又為殿做了窗架子內寬外窄的窗戶。

words.note: Describes a specific architectural feature of windows.

verses.text: 緊靠殿牆，就是圍著外殿和內殿的牆，他又建造平臺，圍繞殿的四周，做成廂房。

words.note: Refers to the Holy Place in the Jerusalem Temple.
Refers to the Most Holy Place (Holy of Holies) in the Jerusalem Temple.
A verb-complement structure indicating completion or transformation.
Refers to the chambers built around the Temple structure.

verses.text: 廂房的下層寬兩公尺兩公寸；中層寬兩公尺七公寸；第三層寬三公尺一公寸。他在殿牆外面四周留有暗架，所以梁木不必插入殿牆裡。

words.note: Refers to a specific type of room attached to the main temple structure.
Lit. 'public foot', a standard meter.
One tenth of a meter. Less common than meter/centimeter.
Refers to ledges or offsets built into the temple wall to support beams without inserting them.

verses.text: 建殿是用採石場預備好了的石料；所以建殿的時候，在殿裡聽不到鎚子、斧頭或任何鐵器的聲音。

words.note: Used as a resultative complement indicating completion or readiness.
Connects a modifying clause to a noun.
Forms a noun phrase 'the time of building the temple'.
Resultative complement '不到' indicates failure to achieve the verb's goal.

verses.text: 廂房的下層門在殿的右邊，人可以從螺旋形梯子上廂房的中層，再從中層上到第三層。

words.note: Indicates a subsequent action.
Resultative verb indicating reaching a destination by ascending.

verses.text: 所羅門建殿，建造完成以後，就用香柏木的棟梁和香柏木的木板做殿的天花板。

words.note: Indicates a consequence or immediate succession of events.
A type of fragrant cypress or cedar wood, often used in ancient construction.
Refers to the main structural beams of a roof or building.
Lit. 'sky flower board', referring to decorative ceilings.

verses.text: 靠著聖殿所建的廂房，每層高兩公尺兩公寸，都用香柏木的梁木與殿連接。

words.note: Indicates a continuous state of proximity or support.
Forms a passive or nominal construction, e.g., 'that which was built'.

verses.text: 耶和華的話臨到所羅門說：
「關於你正在建造的這殿，如果你遵行我的律例，實行我的典章，謹守我的一切誡命，並且照著去行，我就必向你實現我應許你父親大衛的話。

words.note: Often used in religious or legal contexts.
Emphasizes careful and diligent observance.
Refers to divine commands, e.g., Ten Commandments.

verses.text: 我必住在以色列人中間，也必不離棄我的子民以色列。」

words.note: Often refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 聖殿內部的工程與裝飾所羅門建殿，並且建造完成。

words.note: Abbreviation for 'Second Book of Chronicles'.
Verb-object compound, specific to temple building.

verses.text: 殿內的牆壁，從地面到天花板，都貼上香柏木，殿內的地面，都鋪上松木板。

words.definition: to put on, to paste on

verses.text: 又建內殿長九公尺，從地面到天花板，他用香柏木板隔開，成為至聖所。

words.note: Refers to the Holy of Holies or innermost part of a temple.
Used here as a verb meaning 'to be long' or 'to have a length of'.
Refers to the inner sanctuary of the Tabernacle and Temple.

verses.text: 內殿前面的外殿長十八公尺。

words.note: Refers to the main hall or Holy Place of a temple.

verses.text: 殿的內部都貼上香柏木，上面刻有匏瓜和初開的花朵，全部都是香柏木，一塊石頭都看不見。

words.note: In a biblical context, often refers to the Temple in Jerusalem.
Refers to a specific type of fruit often depicted in ancient art and architecture.
Used with negation (看不見) to emphasize 'not even one'.

verses.text: 他在殿中預備了內殿，好把耶和華的約櫃安放在那裡。

words.note: Functions here as an adverb indicating purpose.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 內殿長九公尺，寬九公尺，高九公尺；內部都貼上精金，用香柏木做的壇也貼上精金。
殿的內部所羅門都貼上精金，把金鍊掛在內殿的前面，內殿也都貼上精金。

words.note: Refers to the Temple of Solomon in this context.
上 indicates attachment or completion.

verses.text: 他把整個的殿都貼上金子，直到整個的殿都貼完；在內殿的壇，整個都貼上了金子。
在內殿，他用橄欖木做了兩個基路伯，各高四公尺四公寸。

words.note: Transliteration for 'cherubim', celestial beings.
Metric unit, literally 'public foot'.
Metric unit, literally 'public inch'.

verses.text: 第一個基路伯一邊的翅膀長兩公尺兩公寸，另一邊的翅膀也是兩公尺兩公寸；由這翅膀尖到那翅膀尖共有四公尺四公寸。
第二個基路伯的兩個翅膀也是四公尺四公寸長。兩個基路伯的大小和樣式都是一樣的。
第一個基路伯高四公尺四公寸，第二個基路伯也是一樣。

words.note: A metric unit of length; lit. 'public foot'.
A metric unit of length (0.1 meter); lit. 'public inch'.
Literally 'one kind'.

verses.text: 他把兩個基路伯安放在內殿裡面，基路伯的翅膀是張開的；這一個基路伯的一個翅膀接到這邊的牆壁，另一個基路伯的一個翅膀接到另一邊的牆壁，他們另外的兩個翅膀在殿的中間彼此相接。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Implies placing securely.
Refers to the most sacred part of the temple.
Verb-complement compound indicating successful connection.
Verb-complement compound indicating successful connection.
Can also be an adjective 'other'.
Often refers to the Temple of Solomon.
Emphasizes reciprocity.

verses.text: 他又把這兩個基路伯貼上金子。

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.
Verb-complement compound indicating adhesion to a surface.

verses.text: 內殿和外殿周圍的牆壁上，他都刻上基路伯、棕樹和初開的花朵的雕刻。

words.note: Refers to the most sacred part of the temple.
Refers to the outer part of the temple.
Functions as a postposition indicating location.
Verb-complement compound indicating carving onto a surface.
Describes flowers that have just bloomed.
A common word for 'flower'.

verses.text: 內殿和外殿的地板上也都貼上金子。

words.note: Refers to the most sacred part of the temple.
Refers to the outer part of the temple.
Functions as a postposition indicating location.
Verb-complement compound indicating adhesion to a surface.

verses.text: 內殿的入口，他用橄欖木做了門扇、門楣和五根門柱。

words.note: Refers to the Holy of Holies or main part of the temple.
Indicates completion of an action.
The horizontal beam above a door.

verses.text: 他在橄欖木做的兩門上，雕刻上基路伯、棕樹和初開的花朵。他又在基路伯和棕樹上包上了金子。

words.note: Connects an attribute or description to a noun.
Used before measure words; '二' is for counting.
Functions as a locative suffix here.
Celestial beings, guardians of God's presence.

verses.text: 他又照樣為外殿的門，用橄欖木做了四根門柱。
用松木做的兩扇門，這一扇有兩葉，是疊合在一起的，那一扇也有兩葉，也是疊合在一起的。

words.note: Here, refers to a door panel or wing.
Indicates a descriptive phrase modifying an implied noun.

verses.text: 他又在上面刻上了基路伯、棕樹和初開的花朵；又在雕刻上緊貼上金子。

words.note: Here, functions as a noun referring to the carved items.

verses.text: 他又用鑿好了的石頭三層，香柏木一層建造內院。

words.note: Describes stones prepared by chiseling.
Aromatic wood, commonly used for construction in ancient times.
Refers specifically to the inner court of the Temple.

verses.text: 所羅門在位第四年西弗月，奠定了耶和華殿的根基。

words.note: Ancient Hebrew calendar month, corresponding roughly to April/May.
Often used in formal contexts for establishing foundations or principles.
Refers to a grand hall or temple, specifically God's Temple here.

verses.text: 第十一年布勒月，就是八月，聖殿各部分都按照計劃完工了。所羅門共用了七年的時間建造聖殿。

words.note: Ancient Hebrew calendar month, corresponding roughly to October/November.
